title: Platyptilia isoterma
text:
Platyptilia isoterma is a <a href="moth">moth</a> of the family <a href="Pterophoridae">Pterophoridae</a>. It is found in <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>.
The <a href="wingspan">wingspan</a> is about 18 mm. The <a href="head">head</a> is white mixed with dark reddish-fuscous. The <a href="Antenna%20%28biology%29">antennae</a> are grey with a blackish line above. The <a href="Thorax%20%28insect%20anatomy%29">thorax</a> is whitish irrorated (speckled) with dark reddish-fuscous and the <a href="abdomen">abdomen</a> is dark reddish-fuscous sprinkled with whitish, and mixed with blackish on the sides towards the middle. The <a href="Insect%20wing">forewings</a> are reddish-fuscous irrorated with whitish and sprinkled with dark fuscous. The hindwings are grey, mixed with black <a href="Scale%20%28anatomy%29">scales</a> on the <a href="dorsum%20%28anatomy%29">dorsum</a>.
